workflow.name: Create WooCommerce products via Telegram bot with Google Gemini AI
workflow.description:
**How it Works?**

1. User Answers Questions Prompted by the Telegram Bot
2. Data Tables are updated to with relevant step of the process and a chat id
3. Upon Approval, the Title, Description and Slug are created and then Product is created on WooCommerce via API request.
4. Data Tables are reset and user is prompted to create another product.

**Setup Steps:** (25 Minutes)
1. Create a Telegram bot via @botfather on telegram
2. Setup 2 Data Tables with names WooCommerce Product Manager & User_Images
3. Add your  Preffered LLM Credentials and set credentials in telegram node 
4. In TelegramGroupMedia node and EditFields 1 node, add your bot token to replace {{your bot token}}
5. Voila! Your Workflow is now configured.

workflow.name: Telegram Bot Based WooCommerce Product Creator

parameters.text: "Great. Now, please send all of your product images. You can send them one by one or all at once. When you are finished, just tap on done.
Excellent. What is the regular price of your product? (e.g., 29.99)
Welcome! To begin, what is the name of the product you'd like to create?
Your previous product was created! Want to make another? Reply with /start or anything to begin.

=<persona>
You are an expert SEO copywriter and e-commerce merchandiser. Your specialty is writing clear, persuasive, and attribute-rich product descriptions that sell.
</persona>

<context>
Your goal is to generate a unique, SEO-friendly product description based on a provided product title and features list. The description must follow a specific format and be written in simple, easy-to-understand language.
</context>

<input_data>

Product Title: {{ $node["Edit Fields"].json["title"] }}
Product Features: {{ $node["Edit Fields"].json["features"] }}
</input_data>

<tasks>

Analyze the Inputs: Carefully examine the provided Product Title and Product Features list. Use these as the primary source of information for your description.

Write the Opening Paragraph: Create a short, engaging introduction (2-3 sentences). Start by incorporating the Product Title naturally. Describe the product's main appeal or what makes it special, using information from the provided features.

Create the Features List:

Add the heading "Features:".

Below the heading, create a bulleted list of key features.

Each bullet point must start with a bolded sub-heading followed by a colon (e.g., Vibrant Design:).

The description for each feature must be based only on the provided Product Features list.

Write the Closing Paragraph: Write a concise concluding sentence or two that summarizes the product's value and provides a positive final impression, reinforcing why it's a great choice.

</tasks>

<output_format_and_style>

Structure: You must follow this exact format:

An introductory paragraph.

The heading "Features:".

A bulleted list of features.

A concluding paragraph.

Language Simplicity: The language must be extremely simple and clear. Use short sentences and common words.

Feature Sub-headings: The bolded sub-headings in the feature list should be general and descriptive (e.g., Unique Shape:, Premium Material:, Eye-Catching Colors:, Smart Functionality:).
</output_format_and_style>

<output_constraints>

Provide only the final product description in the specified format. Do not include any other text, explanations, or your persona description.

CRITICAL: Do not include any information that is not present in the provided Product Title or Product Features list.

Do not include any personal names, dates, or years.

Do not use the Product Title exactly as provided in the input, rather split it up as per your need to explain features. For example: "Pink Bottle of Perfume" is the title, then you can use "this perfume is best for party wear and occasions."
</output_constraints>

=<persona>
You are an expert SEO copywriter who excels at crafting concise, impactful, and attribute-rich short product descriptions for e-commerce.
</persona>

<context>
Your goal is to generate a single, compelling paragraph to be used as a short product description. It needs to be optimized for search engines by quickly highlighting the product's key features and primary benefit, based on a given title and features list.
</context>

<input_data>

Product Title: {{ $node["Edit Fields"].json["title"] }}
Product Features: {{ $node["Edit Fields"].json["features"] }}
</input_data>

<tasks>

Analyze the Inputs: Review the provided Product Title and Product Features list to identify the most prominent attributes and the main purpose of the product.

Construct the Description: Write a single, flowing paragraph that follows this logical sequence:

Start with a short, engaging phrase that relates to the product's use (e.g., "Elevate your style with...", "Add a touch of elegance to your home with...").

Seamlessly integrate the full Product Title.

Clearly list 2-3 key attributes from the provided features, connecting them with words like "featuring," "designed with," or "made from."

Conclude with a concise statement about its ideal use or key benefit (e.g., "...making it perfect for everyday wear," or "...the ideal gift for any occasion.").

</tasks>

<output_format_and_style>

Format: The entire output must be a single, well-written paragraph. Do not use bullet points or multiple lines.

Length: The description should be concise and to the point, generally between 25 and 45 words.

Language Simplicity: The language must be extremely simple and clear.
</output_format_and_style>

<output_constraints>

Provide only the final short description paragraph. Do not include any other text, explanations, or your persona description.

CRITICAL: Only mention attributes or features that are present in the provided Product Title or Product Features list.

Do not include any personal names, specific dates, or years.

Use the Product Title exactly as provided in the input {{ $node["Edit Fields"].json["title"] }}.
</output_constraints>

=<persona>
You are an SEO specialist and web developer, an expert in creating clean, effective, and search-engine-friendly URL slugs.
</persona>

<context>
Your task is to convert a given product title into a perfectly formatted, SEO-optimized URL slug. The slug must be concise, descriptive, and strictly follow the formatting rules provided.
</context>

<input_data>
Product Title: {{ $node["Edit Fields"].json["title"] }}
Product Features: {{ $node["Edit Fields"].json["features"] }}
</input_data>

<tasks>

Read the provided Product Title.

Identify and extract the most important keywords that describe the product's core attributes (e.g., style, color, material, function). Use the Product Features list as additional context to ensure the slug is descriptive.

Assemble these keywords into a URL slug, strictly applying all the rules below.
</tasks>

<slug_rules>

Format: Convert the entire string to lowercase.

Separator: Use hyphens - to separate all words.

Characters: Remove all special characters (e.g., &, ‚Ñ¢, ¬Æ, ', ", ?, !, :, +).

Stop Words: Remove common English stop words (e.g., 'a', 'an', 'the', 'for', 'with', 'in', 'of').

Redundancy: Omit common, generic, or redundant words that add little SEO value (e.g., 'product', 'item', 'style', 'design', 'template', 'new', 'apparel'). The slug should focus on the unique identifiers of the product.

Length: Keep the slug concise and descriptive, aiming for a final length of 3 to 7 words.
</slug_rules>

<examples>

Title: "Handmade Ceramic Coffee Mug with Speckled Glaze"
Slug: handmade-ceramic-coffee-mug-speckled-glaze

Title: "Luxurious Rose & Sandalwood Eau de Parfum for Women"
Slug: luxurious-rose-sandalwood-perfume

Title: "Men's Vintage Graphic Print 100% Cotton T-Shirt"
Slug: vintage-graphic-print-cotton-tshirt
</examples>

<output_constraints>

Output only the final, clean slug.

Do not provide any explanations, prefixes (like "slug:"), or any other text.
</output_constraints>

=<persona>
You are an expert SEO copywriter and e-commerce merchandiser. Your specialty is writing clear, persuasive, and attribute-rich product descriptions that sell.
</persona>

<context>
Your goal is to generate a unique, SEO-friendly product description based on a product image and a provided title. The description must follow a specific format and be written in simple, easy-to-understand language. Every feature mentioned must be directly observable in the image.
</context>

<input_data>
1.  **Image**: {{ $node["HTTP Request"].binary.data }}
2.  **Product Title**: The pre-generated SEO title for the product: `{{ $node["Edit Fields"].json["title"] }}`
</input_data>

<tasks>
1.  **Analyze the Inputs**: Carefully examine the product image to identify its most important visual features, materials, colors, and overall style. Use the provided `Product Title` to anchor your understanding of the product.

2.  **Write the Opening Paragraph**: Create a short, engaging introduction (2-3 sentences). Start by incorporating the `Product Title` naturally. Describe the product's main appeal or what makes it special.

3.  **Create the Features List**:
    * Add the heading "Features:".
    * Below the heading, create a bulleted list of 3-5 key features.
    * Each bullet point must start with a bolded sub-heading followed by a colon (e.g., **Vibrant Design:**).
    * The description for each feature must be based *only* on what is visible in the image.

4.  **Write the Closing Paragraph**: Write a concise concluding sentence or two that summarizes the product's value and provides a positive final impression, reinforcing why it's a great choice.
</tasks>

<output_format_and_style>
* **Structure**: You must follow this exact format:
    1.  An introductory paragraph.
    2.  The heading "Features:".
    3.  A bulleted list of features.
    4.  A concluding paragraph.
* **Language Simplicity**: The language must be extremely simple and clear. Write as if you are explaining the product to a 7-year-old. Use short sentences and common words.
* **Feature Sub-headings**: The bolded sub-headings in the feature list should be general and descriptive (e.g., **Unique Shape:**, **Premium Material:**, **Eye-Catching Colors:**, **Smart Functionality:**).
</output_format_and_style>

<output_constraints>
* Provide only the final product description in the specified format. Do not include any other text, explanations, or your persona description.
* **CRITICAL**: Do not describe any feature, benefit, or detail that cannot be seen or reasonably inferred directly from the image provided (e.g., do not mention "user-friendly editor" for a static image of a digital file,) but do mention reasonable features like you can mention if it‚Äôs a perfume then you can mention it‚Äôs a luxury fragrance, good for daily wear.
* Do not include any personal names, dates, or years.
* DO not sse the `Product Title` exactly as provided in the input `{{ $node["Edit Fields"].json["title"] }}`, rather split it up as per your need to explain features. For example : Pink Bottle of Perfume is the title, then you can use this perfume is best for party wear and occasions.
</output_constraints>

=<persona>
You are an expert SEO copywriter who excels at crafting concise, impactful, and attribute-rich short product descriptions for e-commerce.
</persona>

<context>
Your goal is to generate a single, compelling paragraph to be used as a short product description. It needs to be optimized for search engines by quickly highlighting the product's key visual features and primary benefit, based on its image and a given title.
</context>

<input_data>
1.  **Image**: {{ $node["HTTP Request"].binary.data }}.
2.  **Product Title**: The pre-generated SEO title for the product: `{{ $node["Edit Fields"].json["title"] }}`
</input_data>

<tasks>
1.  **Analyze the Inputs**: Review the product image and the `Product Title` to identify 2-3 of the most prominent visual attributes (e.g., color, material, pattern, shape) and the main purpose of the product.

2.  **Construct the Description**: Write a single, flowing paragraph that follows this logical sequence:
    * Start with a short, engaging phrase that relates to the product's use (e.g., "Elevate your style with...", "Add a touch of elegance to your home with...").
    * Seamlessly integrate the full `Product Title`.
    * Clearly list the 2-3 key visual attributes you identified, connecting them with words like "featuring," "designed with," or "made from."
    * Conclude with a concise statement about its ideal use or key benefit (e.g., "...making it perfect for everyday wear," or "...the ideal gift for any occasion.").
</tasks>

<output_format_and_style>
* **Format**: The entire output must be a single, well-written paragraph. Do not use bullet points or multiple lines.
* **Length**: The description should be concise and to the point, generally between 25 and 45 words.
* **Language Simplicity**: The language must be extremely simple and clear. Write as if you are explaining the product to a 7-year-old.
</output_format_and_style>

<output_constraints>
* Provide only the final short description paragraph. Do not include any other text, explanations, or your persona description.
* **CRITICAL**: Only mention attributes, materials, or features that are clearly visible in the product image.
* Do not include any personal names, specific dates, or years.
* Use the `Product Title` exactly as provided in the input `{{ $node["Edit Fields"].json["title"] }}`.
</output_constraints>

<slug_rules>

* **Characters**: Remove all special characters (e.g., `&`, `‚Ñ¢`, `¬Æ`, `'`, `"`, `?`, `!`, `:`, `+`).
* **Stop Words**: Remove common English stop words (e.g., 'a', 'an', 'the', 'for', 'with', 'in', 'of').
* **Redundancy**: Omit common, generic, or redundant words that add little SEO value (e.g., 'product', 'item', 'style', 'design', 'template', 'new', 'apparel'). The slug should focus on the unique identifiers of the product.
* **Length**: Keep the slug concise and descriptive, aiming for a final length of 3 to 7 words.
</slug_rules>

<examples>

    **Slug**: `handmade-ceramic-coffee-mug-speckled-glaze`
* **Title**: "Luxurious Rose & Sandalwood Eau de Parfum for Women"
    **Slug**: `luxurious-rose-sandalwood-perfume`

    **Slug**: `vintage-graphic-print-cotton-tshirt`

<output_constraints>

* Do not provide any explanations, prefixes (like "slug:"), or any other text.
Hello! Please type /start to begin creating a new product.
Got it. Now, what is the sale price? (Tap on same if there is no discount).
Great! Creating your product now... (It may take up to 1 min for the process to complete)
Action cancelled. Let's start over. What is the product name?

={
  "chat_id": "{{ $('Telegram Trigger').first().json.message ? $('Telegram Trigger').first().json.message.chat.id : $('Telegram Trigger').first().json.callback_query.message.chat.id }}",
  "media": {{ JSON.stringify($input.all().filter(item => item.json.id && item.json.id.trim() !== '').map(item => ({ type: "photo", media: item.json.id.trim() }))) }},
  "disable_notification": false,
  "protect_content": false,
  "reply_to_message_id": null,
  "allow_sending_without_reply": true
}

parameters.text:
=You're a SEO optimization executive. Based on the product name :{{ $('Get row(s)2').item.json.product_name }}, Create a image title and alt tag for image provided here {{ $json.data || $json.image_url || $json }}. The alt tag and title should be relevant to the details visible in the image and product name provided above. The title and alt tag should be in limits prescribed for better rankings on search engines like Google, Bing etc. Title should not be same for every image. It should user relevant keywords that can be used instead of just using product name as title. Product name should be used for title for the first image only. 

** In the output don't state any fluff. Just state the Title and Alt Tag for the images.

=Your Product : {{ $json.name }} has been successfully added into drafts section of your WooCommerce Store. 

Tap on /start to create a new product.

=You're a SEO optimization executive. Based on the product name :{{ $('Get row(s)5').item.json.product_name }}, Create a image title and alt tag for image provided here {{ $json.data || $json.image_url || $json }}. The alt tag and title should be relevant to the details visible in the image and product name provided above. The title and alt tag should be in limits prescribed for better rankings on search engines like Google, Bing etc. Title should not be same for every image. It should user relevant keywords that can be used instead of just using product name as title. Product name should be used for title for the first image only. 

** In the output don't state any fluff. Just state the Title and Alt Tag for the images.

=Your Product : {{ $json.name }} has been successfully added into drafts section of your WooCommerce Store. 

Tap on /start to create a new product.
The Product Creation Process has been aborted. Please type or tap on /start to create a new product.

parameters.content:
# Telegram Bot based WooCommerce Product Creator

## How it works?

- Conversational Interface: The workflow is operated via a Telegram bot. 

- State Management: It tracks user progress using Data Table and Switch nodes, ensuring the bot remembers where you left off (e.g., "awaiting_images" or "awaiting_price").

- AI Copywriting: Once the data is collected, AI Agent analyzes the data to generate a professional product description, a punchy short description, and an SEO-optimized URL slug.

- Image's SEO Optimization: An AI Agent analyzes each uploaded image to create unique SEO Optimized Titles, Alt Tags

- WooCommerce Automation: After the user approves the summary in Telegram, the workflow sends a formatted JSON payload to the WooCommerce REST API to create the product a.

- Cleanup: Once the process is finished or aborted, data tables are cleaned.

## How to use? 

- Initial Setup: You must replace the placeholder WooCommerce URL (https://your-wp-site/) and Telegram Bot tokens with your own credentials.

- Commands: Send /start to the bot to begin the creation process. Use /abort at any time to cancel the current session and clear stored data.

- Workflow's Flow: Follow the bot's prompts. When uploading images, tap the "Done" inline button to move to the pricing step.

- Approval: The bot will send a "Review" message with all details. Tap "Approve" to send the data to WooCommerce.

## Requirements:

1. Telegram Bot: A bot token from @BotFather.

2. LLM's API: An API key to power the LangChain and AI Agent nodes.

3. WooCommerce API: A Consumer Key and Consumer Secret with "Read/Write" permissions.

4. n8n Data Tables: You will need to create two Data Tables: one for WooCommerce Product Manager (session state) and one for User_Images (temporary image storage) with following fields:

### a. WooCommerce Product Manager

- chat_id (String)
- current_step (String)
- product_name (String)
- image_urls (String)
- features (String)
- regular_price (String)
- sale_price (String)

 
### b. User_Images

- chat_id (String)
- file_id (String)
- image_url (String)


## Need Help?

[Ping me on X](https://x.com/matta_kshitij) or [Refer to n8n community](https://community.n8n.io/)!

Happy Automation!

## Bot Trigger & State Query

Telegram trigger polls for callback queries and messages and checks the current status of user in the process of product creation.

## Check for Abort Command

If during the process of product creation user uses abort command, then it resets both data tables and notifies user about it

## Check for Chat ID field in WooCommerce Product Manager Data Table

If a user is in the middle of product creation process then it is passed through to check for relevant steps in product creation process, if not then it's diverted user to prompt for a fresh start.

## Check for /start in Telegram Message

If /start is found in telegram message, the Chat ID is logged in State Management Data Table and Step is Update to awaiting name. If /start is not found and chat id is empty then it is a result of /abort command. And as aborting is a process of part too and chat ID is removed after the initiation of abort prompt, the user is prompted to use the start command.

# Check for approve_product in Telegram Callback Query

If Appove button is pressed in telegram bot, it proceeds to product creation with information provided by the user

## Check for Features
Checks if features are provided or not by the user

## If Features are provided by the user

The workflow utilises the information provided along with features to create Description, Short Description, Slug and then it creates the product with provide information on WooCommerce and notifies the user about product creation.

## If Features are not provided by the user

The workflow utilises the information provided along to create Description, Short Description, Slug and then it creates the product with provide information on WooCommerce and notifies the user about product creation.

## If Disapproved
If it is disapproved by the user, it sets the state equal to the first step of the process which prompts user for step 1 of process

## Asks for Product Name
Prompts the user to enter product name and changes the current step in data table to awaiting images

## If User has clicked Done button after Uploading Images on Telegram bot
Image URLs added into the user images data table are separated by a comma and user is prompted to go to next step

## If User hasn't clicked Done button after Uploading Images on Telegram bot
Image URLs are added into the user images data table for each image

## If User has clicked None Button for Feature Availability 
Current step changes to Awaiting Regular Price and user is prompted to enter Regular Price of the product.

## If User has Provided Features
Current step changes to Awaiting Regular Price and features are added into the Product Manager Data Table

##  User Provides Regular Price
Current step changes to Awaiting Sale Price and Regular Price is added into the WooCommerce Product Manager Data Table
## Checks if user presses "Same" button for Sale Price

##  User Provides Sale Price
Adds Sale Price and Prompts user to confirm if all the data is correct or not before asking for approval

## Prompts User about completion and Resets Data Table

Prompts user with a message about completion of process and resets data table for new product creation

user.name: Kshitij Matta

data.details:
The IF node can be used to implement binary conditional logic in your workflow. You can set up one-to-many conditions to evaluate each item of data being inputted into the node. That data will either evaluate to TRUE or FALSE and route out of the node accordingly.

This node has multiple types of conditions: Bool, String, Number, and Date & Time.

data.details: The Code node allows you to execute JavaScript in your workflow.
